                    (opens in new window) How to Apply for First-Time and TransferComplete Your ApplicationApplications to Chico State are completed online through Cal State Apply.Check Your StatusAfter applying, log in to your Portal and navigate to the Student Center to check your admission status.Accept Admissions OfferOnce you have been offered admission, commit to Chico State by submitting your intent to enroll.DeadlinesUndergraduate Domestic Application DeadlinesSpring Application: August 1–September 30Fall Application: October 1–June 1, 2023Undergraduate Domestic Intent to Enroll DeadlinesSpring Intent to Enroll: November 15Fall Intent to Enroll: May 1International Applicant DeadlinesGraduate Applicant DeadlinesPrograms and ResourcesCalifornia Promise ProgramProvides special advising, priority registration, and graduation guarantees to low income and first-gen students.Early Start ProgramFor accepted students only. You may see the Early Start Program in your student portal.Educational Opportunity ProgramA program helping low income and first generation students succeed at Chico State.Western Undergraduate ExchangeSave up to $9,010 each year as an out-of-state student.Chico State VETS OfficeHelping Veterans, active duty/national guard/reservists, and dependents receive VA educational benefits.More Student ResourcesBrowse the resources and services offered to current students at Chico State.Application Tips[+] Expand All[–] Collapse AllGeneral Application QuestionsWhat does residency mean?Read more on our residency page.What if I want to apply to more than one campus?You'll use Cal State Apply to apply to all California State University (CSU) campuses of your choosing. Select all campuses and program to which you wish to apply.What identifying numbers do I use?Use your social security number, if you have one, omitting dashes.You can also enter your SSID and/or campus ID if you have one, though this is optional.Issues with Cal State ApplyHave your CAS ID# when contacting Cal State Apply. It can be found in the upper-right corner of your application.Email: CalStateApply@liaisoncas.com Phone: 857-304-2087Monday - Friday, 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. PTResponse times can be up to three business days.Making Changes to Your ApplicationSubmit an application changes form (PDF) or call the Admissions Office to notify us of changes to your application.Changes include:D or F gradesaddress changes, email, or phone number changeschanges to your majorDecision Timeline and Application StatusApplicants will be notified of admission status by April 1 on the Chico State Portal and via email. Your Chico State Portal is the first place to see your decision.Having trouble with your Chico State Portal access? Activate your portal or troubleshoot issues.International and internationally educated students must have all required documents submitted by March 1.We may request additional information in order to make a decision. Please check your email regularly to make sure you don't miss a request.Any CSU, Chico student or applicant for admission to CSU, Chico has the right to be free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation. If you feel you have been subjected to the aforementioned, consult Executive Order 1097 or contact Student Conduct, Rights, and Responsibilities at 530-898-6897.Take the Next StepsHow to ApplyTake a tourRequest InformationContact Undergraduate Admissions: Call us Monday–Friday, 8 a.m.–5 p.m., to talk directly to an admissions expert. Or use live chat during our open hours. No automated voice messages—we promise!530-898-6322, info@csuchico.edu.Graduate Studies  |  International StudentsWe acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, the Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus.We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.MenuChico State HomeAboutAcademicsAdmissionsCost & AidStudent LifeAcademic DepartmentsAthleticsAlumniParentsChico FactsGiveResourcesQuicklinksCampus CalendarCampus SafetyJob OpportunitiesAccessibility Resource CenterAnnual Security Report (PDF)
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
